metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27843 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenJPEG in versions prior to 2.4.0. This flaw allows an attacker to provide specially crafted input to the conversion or encoding functionality, causing an out-of-bounds read. The highest threat from this vulnerability is system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sahnaseredini> the fix is not complete in bionic as the poc is still working. Also there's a commit in the upstream (07d526e) that is reverting some optimisations and (apparently) fixes the issue, however, it does not relate to the CVE, and looks more like a bug fix.

criterions.comment: blender package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit4 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
openjpeg2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
